psimpers.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*++
00002 
00003 Copyright (c) 1989  Microsoft Corporation
00004 
00005 Module Name:
00006 
00007     psimpers.c
00008 
00009 Abstract:
00010 
00011     This module implements the NtImpersonateThread() service.
00012 
00013 
00014 Author:
00015 
00016     Jim Kelly (JimK) 20-Apr-1991
00017 
00018 Revision History:
00019 
00020 --*/
00021 
00022 #include "psp.h"
00023 
00024 
00025 NTSTATUS
00026 NtImpersonateThread(
00027     IN HANDLE ServerThreadHandle,
00028     IN HANDLE ClientThreadHandle,
00029     IN PSECURITY_QUALITY_OF_SERVICE SecurityQos
00030     )
00031 
00032 /*++
00033 
00034 Routine Description:
00035 
00036     This routine is used to cause the server thread to impersonate the client
00037     thread.  The impersonation is done according to the specified quality
00038     of service parameters.
00039 
00040 
00041 
00042 Arguments:
00043 
00044     ServerThreadHandle - Is a handle to the server thread (the impersonator, or
00045         doing the impersonation).  This handle must be open for
00046         THREAD_IMPERSONATE access.
00047 
00048     ClientThreadHandle - Is a handle to the Client thread (the impersonatee, or
00049         one being impersonated).   This handle must be open for
00050         THREAD_DIRECT_IMPERSONATION access.
00051 
00052 
00053     SecurityQos - A pointer to security quality of service information
00054         indicating what form of impersonation is to be performed.
00055 
00056 
00057 
00058 Return Value:
00059 
00060     STATUS_SUCCESS - Indicates the call completed successfully.
00061 
00062 
00063 --*/
00064 
00065 {
00066 
00067 
00068     KPROCESSOR_MODE PreviousMode;
00069     NTSTATUS Status;
00070     PETHREAD ClientThread, ServerThread;
00071     SECURITY_QUALITY_OF_SERVICE CapturedQos;
00072     SECURITY_CLIENT_CONTEXT ClientSecurityContext;
00073 
00074     //
00075     // Get previous processor mode and probe and capture arguments if necessary
00076     //
00077 
00078     PreviousMode = KeGetPreviousMode();
00079     if (PreviousMode != KernelMode) {
00080 
00081         try {
00082 
00083             ProbeForRead( SecurityQos,
00084                           sizeof( SECURITY_QUALITY_OF_SERVICE ),
00085                           sizeof( ULONG )
00086                           );
00087             CapturedQos = (*SecurityQos);
00088 
00089         } except( EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER ) {
00090             return( GetExceptionCode() );
00091         }
00092 
00093     } else {
00094 
00095         CapturedQos = *SecurityQos;
00096 
00097     }
00098 
00099 
00100     //
00101     // Reference the client thread, checking for appropriate access.
00102     //
00103 
00104     Status = ObReferenceObjectByHandle(
00105                  ClientThreadHandle,           // Handle
00106                  THREAD_DIRECT_IMPERSONATION,  // DesiredAccess
00107                  PsThreadType,                // ObjectType
00108                  PreviousMode,                 // AccessMode
00109                  (PVOID *)&ClientThread,       // Object
00110                  NULL                          // GrantedAccess
00111                  );
00112 
00113     if ( !NT_SUCCESS(Status) ) {
00114         return Status;
00115     }
00116 
00117     //
00118     // Reference the client thread, checking for appropriate access.
00119     //
00120 
00121     Status = ObReferenceObjectByHandle(
00122                  ServerThreadHandle,           // Handle
00123                  THREAD_IMPERSONATE,           // DesiredAccess
00124                  PsThreadType,                // ObjectType
00125                  PreviousMode,                 // AccessMode
00126                  (PVOID *)&ServerThread,       // Object
00127                  NULL                          // GrantedAccess
00128                  );
00129 
00130     if ( !NT_SUCCESS(Status) ) {
00131         ObDereferenceObject( ClientThread );
00132         return Status;
00133     }
00134 
00135 
00136     //
00137     // Get the client's security context
00138     //
00139 
00140     Status = SeCreateClientSecurity (
00141                  ClientThread,          // ClientThread
00142                  &CapturedQos,          // SecurityQos
00143                  FALSE,                 // ServerIsRemote
00144                  &ClientSecurityContext  // ClientContext
00145                  );
00146 
00147     if ( !NT_SUCCESS(Status) ) {
00148         ObDereferenceObject( ServerThread );
00149         ObDereferenceObject( ClientThread );
00150         return Status;
00151     }
00152 
00153 
00154     //
00155     // Impersonate the client
00156     //
00157 
00158     Status = SeImpersonateClientEx( &ClientSecurityContext, ServerThread );
00159 
00160     SeDeleteClientSecurity( &ClientSecurityContext );
00161 
00162     //
00163     // Done.
00164     //
00165 
00166 
00167     ObDereferenceObject( ServerThread );
00168     ObDereferenceObject( ClientThread );
00169 
00170     return Status ;
00171 }
